comment: Instructions for assignments are vague. Grades discussion posts and essays harshly. Quizzes ask for extremely specific details from the video lectures. Quizzes are 10 questions in 10 minutes with some free response. Majority of grade is based on discussion posts and essays
rating_tags: Tough grader--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Pros: clear organization of the course, good communicatio, takes late work without penalty, friendly, lots of extra credit, passionate about the subject. Cons: lots of reading- a chapter a week, can be very picky about answers on quizzes, some writing assignments tough for a survey course or if you are not into history
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: Be ready to write papers. Do every extra credit assignment.Quizzes are 2 attempts and open notes no lockdown. 5, 500-word papers and you get 2 attempts. Very understanding and is an easy class to pass just don't slack. If you stay up in the beginning of the semester you may not have to do later assignments. Take him, good luck!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--So many papers

comment: I did get by, by not doing some readings but it would help a lot to do them. There is a quiz every week but it is 4 questions max and he often gave the answers for the questions in class before the quiz. Some of the quizzes were open book and notes and some were only open notes. Two tests (midtern and final exam) group project, and discussions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: His lectures were informative and amusing. The textbook is refreshing and straightforward. Weekly quizzes paired with discussion posts or a one page essay. He is understanding of any personal issues as long as you inform him ahead of time. Provides generous feedback and opportunity to improve. Answers ALL emails quickly.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: took his class for survey of world history, very easy class as long as you show up and do the quiz and discussion you should have a pretty high grade in the class. he gives good feedback and is very passionate about his content but he doesnt bore you and hes very clear on assignments. highly recommend him
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Professor McCandless is a fair grader who provides detailed feedback. The class has a challenging workload, but using resources like unstuck study can help manage the essays and quizzes. Overall, it's a rewarding course if you're willing to put in the effort.
Extremely heavy workload. Required lectures, textbook readings, harsh grader.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Easy online summer class, 3 500-word essays, 30-point overall max extra credit opportunities, easy weekly quizzes.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: The online class was easy. Quizzes open book with two attempts on the same questions.Four short essays you can revise if you want. Discussion are easy but be sure to read the sources. Answers email right away, flexible on deadlines, willing to let you hand in late work.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He is a very tough grader on his written assignments, which heavily make your grade. He allows 2 attempts on each of his 5 question quizzes, the discussions aren't hard but the essays back2back are just not worth it. I would not recommend McCandless to anyone. He won't appreciate the work you do, he's easily confused, & he's not scared to fail you!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: He literally tried to say I did plagerism when everything was from the book. Worst teacher ever. Please do not take him.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: He was a nice guy and answered back quickly to emails. The test was easy every week and you would get 2 chances with no lockdown. I did not watch any of the lectures. The problem was with the short essays. He graded them so hard. I got a 50 and 70 on the 2 I did before having to drop the class. They are worth a lot!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: This class is an easy A as long as you do the work and follow the rubric for papers. You get two attempts on all quizzes and you only have to answer the questions you got wrong on your second try. He also lets you make corrections on your papers to get better grades. I would definitely take this class again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Attendance isn't required, but there are weekly discussions and quizzes that can only be completed in person. 2 tests, both with an essay and a few multiple-choice questions. He drops your lowest 3 quizzes and discussions so that helps. Overall an easy class if you show up and look over each chapter's key terms before the quizzes!
rating_tags: Hilarious

comment: Attendance is not mandatory BUT quizzes and discussion posts are done only in person. 3 quizzes and 3 discussion posts are dropped. There are 2 exams and each have an essay but he does not grade the essays harshly and plenty of class time is given to write them. Not hard to get an A in this class as long as you show up.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: He is a great educator, but his class is so hard! I am a history ed major, and I've never been so stressed over a course. His exams take multiple days and there are written responses that are marked wrong if you forget to capitalize the first letter, or if you make a spelling error. You will have to write essays in person, under an hour.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework

comment: Prof McCandless was good. I took HIST 1112 over the summer, which was tough but manageable. We had to write three essays with a minimum word count of 500, which is nothing, but if you do the minimum you would also get a minimum grade. I liked his lectures and really appreciated his detailed feedback on my work. He was very helpful and passionate.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--So many papers--Caring

comment: Prof McCandless is one of my favorite teachers I have ever had! He is so caring and understanding of students. He gives a lot of easy extra credit assignments to make sure you get the grade you want. The quizzes have 2 attempts and for the writing assignments he gives great feedback and the opportunity for you to revise it. Super fast responder too
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Caring

comment: I took the class in the summer, and it was definitely worth it. Overall, lots of reading with 3 essays and 3 discussion posts, with feedback on every assignment. Quizes were also given for each chapter and were pretty simple. The professor clearly wants you to succeed from the start; you just need to be able to put in the work for the grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Im taking him for the summer and we really have reading+lecture, followed by quizzes with multiple attempts and 3 writing assignments. While the writing assignments are graded not harsh but strictly, he allows for revisions, is so open about what's needed, and will help you through it all. Great Professor and probably 1 of the only good hist profs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Only downside was class was at 8AM. Otherwise, solid choice for a professor! He gives amazing feedback on all materials. There are weekly quizzes and dicussions; a midterm and final, all taken in class. He definitely prepares you for everything beforehand. Drops 3-4 lowest grades of each quiz/discussion. Highly recommend him but do NOT skip class!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: I have never dropped a class so fast. If you do not care about history, please do not take his class. He expects so much from people who don't care about this topic. I have received countless A's on my papers and received my first ever C from him. He wants every small little detail in his papers and just pushes too hard for no reason.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: The professor is great. However, how he teaches and grades for an online class is horrible. Every assignment is based on the textbook. Lockdown and webcam quiz every week. 5 Discussion posts and 5 essays throughout the semester. Will grade your essay like an English professor, the first time I have ever received B's on my writing.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Accused me of using AI text generators to write my discussion post, first week of class. Writing is something I take pride in doing, and after that I had a bad taste in my mouth about him. He gives you 12 minutes to answer 8 questions for something you learned that week. DNF. The way he teaches the course is not compatible in an online setting.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: His class was great, and everything was pretty much straightforward. If you don't like writing, I would suggest you avoid this class. It wasn't too much he wanted us to write down, outside of his short response assignments, but his lectures will make you want to take good notes. He's also really understanding and cares about his students.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Hilarious

comment: Dr. McCandless is a super great history professor! He made the class very interesting, which helped me learn the material. His assignments aren't bad at all. As long as you go to class and take notes, you should do fine.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Pretty easy to get an A if you do all the assignments!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Professor McCandles is a great teacher. If you don't like history, I recommend taking this teacher because he makes it fun. He is always willing to help his students and is very accessible outside of class. Definitely take him.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: We have weekly quizzes and you need to read the textbook to get a good grade on the quiz. You get two attempts with the quiz.The midterm and final are essays. Sometimes he does unscheduled responses in class but sometimes they are scheduled. Sometimes the questions on the practice quiz are very different from the actual quiz.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I had him early in the morning, but I still looked forward to attending his lectures. He has so much knowledge about his courses and is passionate about it. He sincerely wants to share an unbiased view of the past and give you the tools to do so as well. I am in no way a history buff, but taking his class was so interesting. Take him!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: I would not recommend taking Professor McCandless online. He has failed almost every assignment and does not give out proper feedback. His quizzes are mainly from his lectures and the textbook which isn't bad, but he is the toughest grader I have ever had. It seems impossible to get an A on any of the assignments.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Absolutely love this professor. He gives great feedback on all assignments and allows you to correct work within a certain time period. His lectures are great and he also provides an overview of the textbook chapters so that you can better understand what you read, which really helped me out. He wants you to succeed and cares about your grades!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Very nice and organized. Some grading criteria is a bit confusing and quizzes are all lockdown with webcam. Lots of writing too. Class would probably be much easier for you if you like history, but if not just do your best to read the material. Otherwise probably one of the better history professors to go with.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: Dr. Jamie McCandless was very personable and his lectures made history interesting. He is very enthusiastic about his teaching and about our success. He over-communicates, which is very much needed in an online-only environment. He is a bit picky about our written assignments (essays) which was my weak spot, but I still got an A.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: Great professor! I dislike history but prof McCandless made the class interesting. Open note quizzes, 4 discussion posts, and 3 essays. No tests. Offers good feedback and plenty of extra credit. He lets you redo your essays to boost your grade. Only downside is the textbook readings can be a bit tedious at times but that's not his fault.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment:
Dr. Jamie McCandless is one of the top five instructors I've had at KSU. His lectures are interesting and informative, and his manner of speaking shows quite a bit of wit. He makes a usually dull topic interesting.
He is super communicative. He lets you know exactly what is expected in the class. He provides meaningful feedback on your work.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment:
I HATE history, but I've actually really enjoyed the summer semester with Prof. McCandless. He's quick to grade assignments, responds quickly, and gives such detailed feedback (a paragraph of feedback to each student). Course contained no tests at all, only assignments, discussions and quizzes.
One of the best professors I've had at this school.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Good setup for an online class. I took it as a summer 8-week class so there were 10 chapter quizzes, 4 discussion posts, and 4 papers. He is a tough grader and wants you to improve on every one of them so he gives good feedback. Extra credit is offered. This is not just an easy A class, you have to work for it. No last-minute things.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: There are four writing assignments, 13 quizzes, and five discussions, but there is no final test. His papers are easy to get a good grade on if you don't turn your work in early. The quizzes are open notes with lockdown, so you need the textbook. You don't need to watch the lectures; make sure you write down the notes on the slides for the quiz.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: It is a little challenging if you're not a history fanatic but it becomes more interesting towards the end. There are 4 writing assignments, 13 quizzes and 5 discussions,  but there is no final test. Quizzes were relatively easy once you get the hang of how his quizzes go. He is usually pretty good at what he wants in his feedback and responds fast
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Such a tough grader, he has failed me on almost every single assignment. He did give me an extension on a makeup assignment but he gave me a zero on it to begin with. He is soooo book and lecture heavy. The quizzes are literally impossible. He only grades weekly quizzes, papers and writing assignments. I would never recommend this, not worth it!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I took the class online and it followed a very simple format. Reading every week, discussion post every 3 weeks, paper every 3 weeks. Very easy to follow and he gives great feedback on your papers. This feedback is useful as you get a second opportunity to write all your papers. I hate the reading of this class but it is not his fault.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Professor McCandless was the best! His passion for the material he teaches makes the class very enjoyable! He gives great feedback on your work and is easy to reach outside of class. Most importantly, he wants his students to succeed. He's definitely one of the best professors I've ever had at KSU. Please take him if you have the opportunity to!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Amazing teacher, I would love to have him again. Although it is important to take detailed notes and listen to him lecture he knows what he is doing and is very easily understood. Very flexible, quizzes and tests are open note and are pretty easy as long as you pay attention. Attendance is important though!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Participation matters

comment: He's a super nice prof, and his lectures are pretty interesting for a history class. if you don't take good notes, I wouldn't recommend him tho. he has weekly quizzes and some of the questions can't be found anywhere because he specifically says it in his lecture. the quizzes are open note and open book so its easy to get at least a 70 on them.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: He is a good teacher and clearly enjoys his job. Weekly quizzes are lockdown, and there are a few 500-word essays along with weekly discussions that make up your grade. The final is another essay. Gives extra credit assignments and is a very good communicator.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor McCandless is one of my favorite professors by far! It's important to attend his lectures because he does incorporate lecture questions on quizzes. He is a funny guy and keeps the lectures entertaining! There are so many opportunities to get your grade up in the class and he is very understanding if you are struggling on anything.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Took this as an 8-week summer course online and it wasn't hard but it was TONS of reading and long lecture videos. You have to read a chapter a week, the chapters are long, and there were a couple weeks we had to read 2 chapters. The quizzes are lockdown but open book/notes, so take good notes during lecture and reading and you'll be okay.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: He was a great prof for a summer HIST1112 class! There was a quiz and a discussion due every week and a few writing assignments. Definitely not a hard grader, but the textbook is needed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Respond promptly, the course is not difficult, the teacher is nice, as long as you work hard, you can get good grades
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor McCandless isn't a bad professor. But you definitely have to work to get a good grade. He gives weekly quizzes from the lecture and book which you MUST study. Worksheet due before class and Discussion Response due after, you must complete both to get the class grade. His test are lockdown + webcam essays. Study and you'll get a good grade
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Professor McCandless is the best! Although, his lectures can get boring hes a really great professor. Hes very smart and does anything to help his students. Im glad I got the opportunity to experience him as a professor. My only advice is to pay attention during his lectures and read the textbook.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: I never met a more unnecessary history class in the world, nothing like the traditional history classes 2 essays and a lot of reading. He joked around that hed grade the test hard and said it would be "endless suffering" and thats just what it was, DO NOT TAKE
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Solid prof choice! Hefty amount of reading and long lectures but power through! Take notes during lectures! Open note Quizzes weekly over lect and reading! 2 attempts for each! Do practice quiz! Tests are essays. Also open note and lockdown. Gives prompts ahead of time! Fair grader and gives good feedback! Offers extra credit. Would recommend!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Watch the lecture videos all the way, sometimes he asks questions about things towards the end of the lectures. The textbook chapters are pretty long- divide the chapter into chunks & read every day. Take his pre quizzes at least 3 times, those help too. He gives very clear instructions & great feedback. Overall very nice & well rounded professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. McCandless was a great teacher especially during this pandemic. There were weekly quizzes that were an easy A/B as long as you read the chapter and watch the lectures. There are 5 writing assignments in place of tests as well as the final, so if writing is your strong suit this will be an easy class for you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor McCandless is a solid teacher. He does grade hard, but his feedback helps you achieve a better grade on your next assignment. He is thorough in what he wants and provides great detail on how to achieve success. Also, there is a lot of lengthy lectures; due to covid, he recorded voiceovers that were very helpful in succeeding on exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: This really was a great class. There aren't any tests, he lets you revise your essays, and the lectures are genuinely interesting! There is alot of work to do, so make sure you have the time.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Great Professor! Definitely would recommend. Weekly quizzes. 5 discussion posts. 4 essays and 1 final essay. Gives great feedback. Make sure to read the book and listen to the lectures. Very straightforward course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great class, all your tests are papers with prompts given ahead. If you try youll do good! Also just a good guy :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof. McCandless is a great teacher. He is easily accessible and truly cares about the success of his students. This is during the covid times but he was more than willing to do everything he could to help his students succeed. His class is a little difficult but my firm advice is to take his class!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: I took professor McCandless my freshman year and taking him was the best decision i ever made ! He cares about your grade and always respond and give good feedback if your unsure about something. You get to have 2 attempts to take his quizzes and he gives 3 exams which are essays that are pretty easy ! Overall taking him is your best option !
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: This professor is truly so great. He gives three tests which are essays and are worth 50% but allows you to see the prompts a week beforehand to prepare. There is a quiz for each chapter and he gives you practice tests and two attempts on the real quiz. He is super understanding and accommodating during the pandemic. Take him!!!! Truly a delight.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Hilarious--Caring

comment: Great Professor, all his tests and quizzes were open note and exams were one essay answering a topic that you had a week to prepare for. Hes very understanding and fair. He gives a bit of homework which I doable and doesnt require you to send hours everyday trying to complete it
rating_tags: Amazing lectures

comment: YOU NEED TO WORK FOR YOUR GARDE. Took as a summer class- not an easy class but you will succeed if you put the work in and you will learn so much in the process. He is an amazing professor that gives feedback and is always emphasizing the importance of asking questions. Don't take if you are looking for an easy A.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Inspirational--Tough grader

comment: Grade based on weekly quizzes (open book/notebook, lockdown browser), class discussion posts and three papers. No tests! He participates in discussion and makes you think about what you post. Papers weren't hard - got 100% on two of them, lets you revise to improve grade. Lectures are long, but very interesting. Wish he taught US History, too!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures

comment: Really good professor! He gets back to emails SUPER fast and is always helpful. Took the class over summer and it wasn't hard. Had to watch 2 hour lecture videos per week, but that is a lot shorter than class lectures for the whole week. Would definitely take again. He makes little jokes that are stupid but make you smile.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Overall, great professor. I took an 8AM and he made ancient world history interesting. A great supplement to your morning coffee. Beware, you do have to work for your grade. There are quizzes and a reading Q&A every week and 3 essay exams (50 minutes for each essay). He does let you have some notes, but he does not grade the essays lightly.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: a chapter every week with either a discussion post or an essay. Quizzes every week on lockdown browser and the final was an essay. when he grades your essays he tells you exactly what is wrong and gives you the chance to fix it for a better grade which shot my grade up, plus one extra credit assignment, passed with an A.

I took this class online and at first it seemed like a lot of work. But once you get use to it its not too bad. Every week there is a chapter quiz, and either a discussion or paper that is due. Grading is moderate. I made some great grades on discussions and papers and then some not so great grades. Just put in a little work and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: BEST HISTORY PROFESSOR!!! I actually hate history, but Dr. McCandless made this class fun and interesting. Book is recommended, but I did not use it much. He is extremely understanding and wants the best for his students. There are 3 exams, graded on attendance, 10 online quizzes, and a few graded group discussions. I would highly recommend him!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Hilarious

comment: He can be disorganized and "scatterbrained" (As another reviewer mentioned), but somehow manages to be crass and a harsh grader. He takes points off if initial discussion posts are not completed two days before the due date. He did extend assignment due dates because of COVID-19, however, I would not take this class again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: He was a great professor! He's sarcastic and hilariously self-aware. He somehow made history fun! Lectures are important to go to and worth it. There is plenty of classwork to help make up for a bad test grade, but not too much to be overwhelming. Classwork is easy and interesting. Tests are essays but he gives prompts in advance. Overall amazing!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Took Modern world history online- The class is very easy if you actually read the chapters and listen to the lectures. There's 4 essays, all less than 1000 words, 1 reading chapter and quiz due each week. The quizzes were with lockdown and webcam, but they're very easy if you read the chapter. I would take this class again
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor McCandless is a good professor. We did a quiz every week on a specific chapter, a group discussion post after most quizzes, and writing assignments. He always gave good feedback with the writing assignments and let us fix any mistakes we made on it. If you work hard in this class, it won't be difficult to get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Great Professor, very clear, very understanding. Extremely clear grader, tells you exactly what you need to do to make a 100%. Quizzes due every week, 10 questions fairly simple, writing assignments and discussion posts are the only other assignments. No major tests, an interesting Professor and a very kind person. Would definitely take again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor McCandless is one of my favorite professors I've had so far. His expectations are very clear. If you read the textbook and attend class, you will do well. He is easy to talk to and answers questions without sarcasm or malice.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: don't ever skip class. quizzes are very specific. LECTURE HEAVY. Powerpoints are not helpful at all. talks way too fast. exams are essays but gives you the prompts beforehand. gives good feedback. i personally wouldn't take this class again. he's an okay professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Took the online class. Three essays@500 words. Very clear about what he wants and he lets you submit revisions. Feedback is good. Five discussions + quiz every week over chapter readings. You can take the quiz twice for a higher grade and there is a practice quiz. Not an easy A but the class didn't take much time. He is helpful but is picky.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Jamie makes the course entirely too difficult for it to be an introductory level history course. The grading is very specific and requires significant effort to get an A. Assignments are discussion posts, essays, and quizzes based on his lectures. Every other week is an essay which makes this a writing heavy course. I would not recommend him.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Worst professor I have ever had to deal with. This online course was miserable. His syllabus, due dates, and expectations are completely unclear, and if you try to ask for clarification he will insult you. DO NOT TAKE. He does not care about his students.

This class was not difficult but could be pretty boring. Attendance counts as a grade, there are various quizzes, and two papers (midterm and final). I recommend using the textbook and taking the practice quizzes because notes arent too helpful. Professor McCandless was pretty cool though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: More writing than an English course. Most history classes will have a lot of writing but this seems a bit extreme. Do not even think about taking him online. I wouldn't recommend taking him at all. A bit scatterbrained but still a harsh grader despite that.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Professor McCandless makes this core class way harder than it needs to be. He makes you write a ton of papers and he acts as if it is an English course. Would not prefer you take him unless you have no absolute choice. He should be your last option.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Jamie cares deeply about what he is teaching. This class is lecture heavy but they are helpful. There is a quiz for every chapter but he give study quizzes online to help. Final and midterm is an essay but he gives the question beforehand and lets you ask any questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Jamie is very knowledgeable and truly cares about the subject he's teaching. He often asks questions that encourage you to think critically. There are frequent quizzes so attendance and note-taking are pretty important. The midterm and final are essay questions but he gives you the prompts ahead of time.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring

comment: He assigns a chapter to read every week along with a chapter quiz (you can use your textbook on it). Every other week he gives a writing assignment so definitely read the chapter and stay on top of things. The other weeks are discussion posts. Take him if you are decent at writing and don't like tests (we have writing assignments instead of tests).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Gives good feedback

comment: He cares a lot about what he is teaching, so showing up for lectures is not that bad. Attendance was mandatory, and you wouldn't want to miss anyways since he gives pop quizzes. He does not teach you how to write essays for the midterm or final though so make sure to study a AP world type format beforehand.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Amazing lectures

comment: Lectures suck. Quizzes tough. Tests are essays and graded very harshly. Very hard class considering it is a history class. I do not recommend at all.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Took his online class in the summer and even though it seems tough at first, you actually learn from his class. We had quizzes for every chapter but you could use your book. He uses discussions and essays to really grade you on but he is easily reachable and helps you as much as he can. Not an easy class but definitely a good one.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I found Prof. McCandless to be a good teacher as far as online courses go. He was easily accessible and quick to respond. There was a lot of reading and a good bit of writing but he was clear about what he wanted from your writing and honestly didn't grade too hard as long as you made a good effort to give him what he was asking for.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Dr. McCandless is a solid professor. If he sees you putting forth the effort, he has no problem giving you an A. But you still have to work for it. Have to read about 11 40-pg chapters in 7 weeks. 3 Discussion Posts and 3 Writing Assignments, as well as a paper for the final. It can be a lot if you dont plan ahead, especially in the summer.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Instead of tests he uses essays. He gives you the topics BEFORE the test, but he grades them harder since you already know the topic. Students struggle because of the essays but go to his office hours. He is very helpful and does want his students to be successful. He will not just give out the easy A but if you work hard you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. McCandless is a master lecturer. Most classes are lectures, others deal with primary sources. Quizzes every week about lectures and textbook information. Only Midterm and Final, but they are essays, so you have to know the information to do well.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Excellent lecturer. Finds a way to relate history to modern events and practices. Would take again, but maybe not at 8am next time.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: McCandless is so nice, smart, & funny. He does require difficult papers every 2 weeks and lots of reading. He's always willing to help and responds to emails within minutes! His online class is structured so nicely, and his feedback is great. If you want an easy A or don't like trying, don't take. But do your best and ask for help, you'll do great!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: As an engineering student technology has a big role in my degree. He does not approve of technology of any type in class. He gives quizzes using lockdown browser but let's you use an online textbook. He knows the material well but has a long way to go in how he teaches the class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--So many papers

comment: I hate history classes, his lectures put me to sleep half the time, but his class is really not that hard. His tests at essays but he gives you the prompts a week in advance and you can bring a notecard and pretty much put your whole essay on there if you want. I never got below an A on his tests and I got a 100 on the final.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Quizzes every week are online and you get two tries, open book open note. Puts the lecture slides online and textbook in the library. Tough grader but clear expectations. Hour and a half class period so lectures got long but he did group projects in class to break it up. You have to put in the effort but the class was not hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: I hate history, do with that what you wish. Im not going to cut any corners, you are going to sit there and listen to him talk and switch slides way too fast for what feels like 300 hours. Every now and then he asks the class a question, and then he gets no response because everyone was sleep. All of your tests
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: your tests are essays but he gives good feedback and gives you the exact questions 2 weeks before the test and will you help you with your thesis before. his lectures are not boring but they do feel like forever. there are weekly quizzes that are difficult if you do not take good notes during the lecture.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Quiz every week, and alternating discussions and writing assignments every week. Final is a paper similar to the writing assignments. Provides help when you ask for it and tries to be as specific as possible. I really enjoyed the class but he does make you work for an A so you do have to put in a lot of effort. Quick grader which reduced stress.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Jamie is a great teacher. There is a lot of reading involved. Lots of writing as well. Lectures are a little boring, that's just the nature of it. He wants to see you succeed and will offer extra credit to try to help you pass. 3 papers plus an essay for the final. Test each week and 3 discussion posts. Clear grading and deadlines. Definitely take.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This was a online summer class. His feedback on writing assignments are helpful but are wrapped in little character jabs( obviously you didn't ..). His directions for writing assignments are VERY specific. And if you answer 9/10 parts of the question you "failed to address the question properly". If you love writing and critical feedback take him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great, but lot of work. Quiz weekly, and alternates paper and discussion posts weekly. Final is a paper. Clear and caring. Don't expect it to be easy, but if you take time, you'll get an A no problem. Points system grade.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: There is a clear method to everything he does in the class. You can expect to do the same thing every time with a few exceptions of group assignments which are very easy. He gives plenty of reminders and heads up on anything that is due.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Audio lectures every week. He finally made a transcript, which helped the quizzes every week. Discussion & Writing Assignments alternate weeks. Very open & approachable with confusing assignment topics and any issues with grades/participation. The content in class is boring which doesn't help the motivation to complete the assignments . DON'T TAKE!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: If you are going to take him at least do not do it online. There is a quiz every week on his lecture & the book, a discussion post every other week, and a writing assignment every week there isn't a quiz. His audio lectures are 35-60 minutes long and if you want to take notes (which you should for his quizzes ), it'll take you at least 1-2 hours.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS, HE IS THE WORST PROFESSOR YOU WILL HAVE. weekly quizzes that hard regardless if you read the text or listen to his online lecture. Claims to provide help, however only justifies why he doesn't do certain things, even though it makes the class harder than expected. save yourself a headache and take someone else.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I'm actually surprised by his rating! If you can help it DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! Lots of papers. Your discussions have to be spaced out over 3 hrs and if you don't post by Wednesday you don't get full credit. He's a tough grader and enjoys making us sit through his boring web lectures. If you like to learn history, you won't learn much with him
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Great teacher, lots of quizez but they are online open note and book. tests are essays. 2 group projects. amazing lectures. I would retake him in a heart beat.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He definitely makes you work for your grade. 500 word essay every other week and discussion board posts on the week you don't have essay. He's very interactive as an online prof and give lots of feedback on essays. His quizzes are straight from the book/audio lectures, but they can be tricky. I'm terrible at history, but learned a lot with him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Good teacher but is an extremely hard grader. Tests are essays and I never made above a low B. Two group projects, in class activities, and takes attendance; more than 5 unexcused and you may fail. not my number one choice to take, but you'll survive if you try really hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GROUP PROJECTS--Tests are tough

comment: very organized and professional, but he's a very hard grader and has very long online lectures. has high expectations for work (exams are all papers so if you're not a strong writer don't take him!) online version had a quiz and discussion post/paper every week. don't take if you're looking for an easy A
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Online lectures were amazing and very helpful, semi-easy class just a lot of writing assignments which can be hard to keep up with but you can always work ahead if you need to.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures

comment: I had Professor McCandless for my Pre-moder world history and it was honestly the best. His lectures are always interesting and he is super funny. There are quizzes ever week online but its open book/note so its super easy. His test are all written exams but he gives you the prompts a week or two in advance to prepare.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Hilarious

comment: Prof. McCandless is a really friendly guy who very obviously knows what he is talking about. I took this class at 8AM and he is so interesting and funny that it kept me awake just about every day. His quizzes are easy and he's very clear on what he expects on his exams. He was my best professor during my Freshman year. Also respects students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Lectures go along with the textbook. Frequent quizzes which are easy and help a lot for getting key concepts of chapters. Exams are all written but he clearly states what he's looking for and the feedback is very helpful. Ended with a 95. A very nice, humorous, light hearted guy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Awesome guy. I was struggling with some of my papers and he gave me clear feedback for improvement. I was able to make 100% on my final writing assignment! 10/10 whatever they are paying him it isn't enough
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring

comment: His instructions are not always clear and if you have questions he wasn't much help. You do need the book and the tests are tricky. The Final is 50% of your grade which I thought was very odd for a core class. He's very harsh on grading papers even though he has a lot typos in his instruction documents. His average audio lectures were 1:30 long.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: First off, do not take this class online if you are taking a bunch of other classes over the summer. I suggest taking it during a regular semester unless you're only taking this one class during the summer. Some of his questions on the quiz are very unclear, and its almost a trick question. You really have to work for this class. Reading is heavy.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Overall, he is an okay teacher. I took his 8 wk class online over the summer. His quizzes are a little hard and you NEED the book to answer them. Every week we had quizzes, discussion posts and writing assignments between 500-750 words. He grades the writing assignments a little to harshly. Also, he has his own grading scale where a 90-91 is a B.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I took his class online and found it very easy. I always waited till the last day to do everything and still made an 89. I was lazy so I would say it is an easy A class. He's always willing to help if you have questions. He would swap off between one "paper", one quiz, or one quiz, one discussion post a week. Book has all answers so must get it!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback

comment: I really enjoyed this class. He's a great professor, gives entertaining lectures, and is definitely a fair grader. He makes a lot of jokes so you won't be bored. He gave quizzes each Friday so you definitely need a textbook in order to take them. Show up to his lectures because the PP doesn't have all the info. I would definitely take him again.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor McCandless is awesome, he really makes the subject interesting and his lectures engaging. He cares about his students and will take a personal interest in helping you pass. Also, he has a great sense of humor. Thoroughly enjoyed his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: He does a great job filling his lectures with all kinds of jokes and references, and really made history interesting. The power points however are just headlines for the in depth material he does in lectures, so attendance is important, but I found the book to be optional. Great class overall, definitely would recommend
rating_tags: Participation matters--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: There are a good bit of papers for this class, but they aren't hard and he gives a lot of help if you need it. There's 10 quizzes throughout the semester but there is an online practice quiz to help you study for each quiz. The only tests are the midterm and the final which are both essay format. He is very funny and witty and makes class enjoyable
rating_tags: Hilarious

comment: He was a great professor! I feel like he always kept the class engaged and the quizzes were easy as long as you studied the material he went over! Very interesting class and he also was very willing to help the students at any time!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Mccandless was new to KSU and made a lot of jokes to light up a boring subject. There is a quiz on each chapter, 5 engagements with groups in class or online in a discussion, 2 exams (including the final, which were in class essays), and 2 writing assignments. This is not an easy A and is a bit of a challenge but I recommend him fully.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I really enjoyed this class, he kept lectures interesting with some jokes here and there. There are a quiz on each chapter and this class does not rely on exams, instead you will write a few papers but he grades them very lightly as it is a Gen Ed. class. As a senior i thought it was a nice and easy class to mix in with my work-heavy, classes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Had him at 8AM MWF and Prof. McCandless never put me to sleep. His lectures weren't particularly interesting all the time, but he is great for a history teacher. Would take him again if I could for US History. He responds to emails quick, sticks to his word, and is really witty. Lowkey hilarious af. Take him if you have the opportunity!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria
